page.title: 10Roads
page.content: Roads in the area vary from small {private roads}giving access to farm property, to the{A1.(dual carriageway) The map indicates that there have been 3 separate main roads built at various times. The first road passed through {Weston,}and was later rebuilt to by-pass the village, meeting the demands of greater volumes of road traffic. When the present A1 was built, it was designed as a much straighter, more direct route, with intersections and bridges indicative of modern motorways. It is an extremely busy trunk road, taking most of the long-distance traffic heading north and south through the eastern region of Britain. {Crow Park Farm}was divided by the new A1, so planners were obliged to build an extra roadbridge solely for the purpose of access to the farmland.
